content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the overall trend on the table?

choices.label: Fertility rates remained consistent across Europe from 1960 to 2000.
Fertility rates declined in Eastern and Southern Europe, but remained steady in Western Europe from 1960 to 2000.
Fertility rates declined across Europe from 1960 to 2000.
Fertility rates increased in Southern Europe, but declined in Western and Eastern Europe from 1960 to 2000.

topic.text: 9.14: 20th- and 21st-Century Culture, Arts, and Demographic Trends

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
